topic.title: What brought you here, pals?
topic.body:
I've been around here for a couple of days,  and I saw people talking about the fact that here you can express yourself without being warried of censorship. On the other hand - except porn and copyright related things - I don't see those many censorable contents.

So what are the most of you/us/they using ZeroNet for?

Is this a need of speaking about everything with the taste of being ceiled into shadows?
It is a need to proxy everything into tor and bypass our firewalls/traffic inspectors at office/University/kind of?

Is it the taste of "good old days" when people used Internet not to watch TV but to inform each other on how to do something?

What's the truth?

topic.title: ~250 Programming ebooks
topic.body:
Hi all,

months ago I was looking for some python manuals and I fell into a ~250 manuals github repository. If you are interested, just follow the link in my blog (it's Italian, but there's just one link so...)

http://127.0.0.1:43110/14xgnGFPTgp7kWq7FqhYJPxJpery6tZgeD/?Post:6:Quella+volta+che+trovai+~250+manuali+di+informatica

topic.title: What happened to hackers and wannabe?
topic.body:
How comes that in a ZeroNet like this there are not that many hacking topics?
Haven't I searched enough?

1560821466_1CFQMjPvz8m5BHtMnGyE7tRktdQ69.body: TBH I do not use ZeroNet. In fact this message will self-destruct in 5 seconds.

1560020808_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehE.body:
Isn't "Always tor" mode enough?
Every DNS requests should go through it, don't they?
I use socat for this:

socat UDP4-LISTEN:53,reuseaddr,fork\  SOCKS4A:127.0.0.1:dns4torpnlfs2ifuz2s2yf3fc7rdmsbhm6rw75euj35pac6ap25zgqad.onion:253,socksport=9050

https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/fun-stuff/dns-over-tor/

1560935624_1FqSXCYG7aTFqtAbtRi1qQ7ZEprgp.body:
> [leftside](#comment_799_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): Italian -> gave up. lol

I know, but the link is unique, you have just to click :P

> [andax](#comment_11_1D8TYfuxwgwt6q3Qf5fKNDqFH1ztqJfZaH): Learning python is not just in my todo 

Thanks for you links mate :)
The github repo I found contains a lot of other programming languages. 
Still I do not understand how a repo like that is still surviving since it cotanins all copyrighted contents :)

1561014446_1FqSXCYG7aTFqtAbtRi1qQ7ZEprgp.body:
> [alexandre9099](#comment_20_16jR7jLoJPHcGJV9tE1uSugPNMNDvS4zXA): Is there any file size limit or something on zeroup? If not why separating the file in multiple parts?
Yes there is: it's 200 mb and we can upload only some formats (.zip, .tar.gz, mp4 and few more). That's why I had to split, then zip (and not the viceversa, for example). If you're interested in something in particular just ask for the upload :)

> [alexandre9099](#comment_21_16jR7jLoJPHcGJV9tE1uSugPNMNDvS4zXA): Bummer, i thought it had no limit (like torrents), do you have an idea when the "test period" will end?

Actually I do not have ideas... I've been using zeronet for less than a week. I suppose we can open an issue on its github page :|

1561066486_1HiSNH8Uh5LSRjqxtrZrBUEquny9D.body:
Hi guy,
can you point out why you do want to install a hidden os instead of a persistent - live USB distro? I've been using it in my office for 3 years...

1561540663_1FqSXCYG7aTFqtAbtRi1qQ7ZEprgp.body: Actually not much, I just wrote "hack" in the search function :P . Anyhow, I was looking at ZeroTalk and I saw various topics, but not that many about software hacking, penetration tests, network related topics as I expected. I thought that - after porn - these would have been the main topics, while obviously they are not.

> [h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm](#comment_370_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11): Hacking the system is Useless.http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1561847632_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11/Hacking+the+system+is+Useless [...]

How can you say hacks are useless?
Breaking into systems is just one aspect of it, and as far as I know it's more "cracking".
Here hacking is intended as the art or breaking into code (and not systems) to improve it, make it be possibile on different platforms ans similar. The samba suite was all about reverse engineering the netbios behaviour. 
Don't teach youngers that hackers are something crackingful.
If you get obfuscated code from a maleware it's more likely to be an hacker to find out what it does, than a regular programmer.
And what about bug hunters?

It's fine if "they" find you when you're "hacking" then, at least you'll be rewarded by the very same software houses because you pointed out a flaw.
